title: Humphrey Jennings Compilation
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945
abstract: Fires were started (80 min. 1943)--Listen to Britain (20 min. 1942)--Words for battle (8 min. 1941)--The True story of Lili Marlene (21 min. 1943)
description: A compilation of works by Humphrey Jennings. "Fires Were Started": Jenning's only semi-documentary feature about a waterfront fire service station during the blitz in London. "Listen to Britain": production of the sights and sounds of people at war, without commentary. "Words for Battle": spoken. "True story of Lili Marlene": dramatic reconstruction of the British counter-propaganda campaign against the popular German forces programme from Belgrade Radio.
